body.name: Kllsmdesign Pwm Fan Temperature Controller Integrator, Remote Control Computer RGB Light Adapter , 8 * 4 Pin Fan Speed Controller Ports , 10 * 5v 3pin A-RGB Ports with Magnet （Black）
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Sunday, February 18 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 17 hrs 58 mins
features: Desktop Computer P-argb Fan Temperature Control Controller:direct SATA Power Input, support 8 PWM intelligent temperature control (4-pin) + 10 5V ARGB interface (3-pin) + remote wireless remote control three in one function, enables users to optimally expand cooling capability within the chassis
Cool Luminous Shell: The fan thermostat looks like a sports car, length: 118mm, width: 55mm, height: 24mm
Accessories: The package contains RGB fan thermostat x1, SATA power cable x1, temperature control cable x1, motherboard sync cable x1

Wireless Remote Control Function: The controller is equipped with a wireless remote control switch, which can freely switch between the hosting mode and the remote control mode. There are about 365 light modes to choose from
PWM Fan Controller: The back uses a magnet device, which is easy to be attached to the inside of the chassis for easy installation. Supports 5v motherboards such as ASUS, MSI, Gigabyte, and ASRock.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Pwm Fan Temperature Controller Integrator The new P-ARGB temperature control controller has a new cool luminous shell.Support PWM intelligent temperature control +5V ARGB motherboard synchronization + wireless remote control three in one function.8 temperature control 4PIN ports + 10 5V ARGB portsThe bottom magnetic suction design makes the installation more convenient.

Multiple Interfaces Support Pwm Intelligent Temperature Control5v Argb Motherboard SynchronizationTemperature Control 4pin Interface*85v Argb Interface*10 Remote Control The wireless remote control can switch between hosting mode and remote control mode. the remote control mode supports up to 360 multiple modes, including static lighting, breathing mode, flashing mode, rainbow mode, colorful loop, comet effect, lightning effect, wave effect, music rhythm and more！ Products and Accessories Temperature Control Host *1Remote Control *1Sata Power Cable*1Temperature Signal Cable*1Argb Sync Cable*1

Magnetic Bottom Design There is a Large Area Magnet at the Bottom of the Controller,Which Has Strong Adsorption Force and is Easy to Install.No Holes, No Screws Top and Side Ports Left Interface: Host Restart Button Interface*1;Sata Hard Drive Power Supply Interface*1;5v 3pin Motherboard Sync Line*1 Right Interface: Argb Interface*2Temperature Control Signal Line*1 (connected to Cpu Fan) Long Side Interface Front Side: PWM Interface*4(red is the Link Cpu Cooler); ●ARGB Interface*4 Rear Side: PWM Interface*5ARGB Interface*5 360 More Light Mode There Are Many Light Modes for You to Choose:Static, Breathing, Flashing, Rainbow, Comet, Lightning Mode, Wave Effect, Yo-yo Effect, Music Rhythm Effect,etc.The Brightness Increases, the Brightness Decreases,The Speed Increases, the Speed Decreases; Magnetic Bottom Design Top and Side Ports Long Side Interface 360 More Light Mode

Interface Installation Method& Multiple Interfaces Installation Method, Refer to the Schematic Diagram on the Picture:The Product Comes with a Manual, It is Recommended to Read How to Use It Correctly, So That You Have a Perfect Light World

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I wasn't too sure about this argb/fan hub when I first found it. I needed something that was affordable but had alot of 5v argb ports as well as fan ports. For 20$ i really can't complain too much about it. The controller works just fine but you do have to be someone's close to the case for the hub to pick up the signal.I'm sure people would like a more customizable lighting array but I don't use rainbow or anything like that, just one solid color so it works good for my builds.It has a magnetic back to the hub and it's definitely strong enough. Also cool that the hub itself has built in rgb which I didn't know when I bought it.All in all, I'd recommend it for a budget option if you need a 4pin fan and 5v argb hub with controller.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent argb controller
reviews.reviewText: I use this as an argb 3 pin controller. My case has a fan/argb hub and also a controller built in, but i have 8 argb fans running and don't want to overload the motherboard connection and the MSI bios has no argb control, nor do I want to use the case controller which requires installing Cooler masters software.I just want a controller to display a static color and requires no software and also one with enough channels where I don't have to use a splitter plugging 2 or more devices into a single channel.With this I can plug each individual argb connection into the controller which doesn't over load the system (no dimming lights when using too many argb devices on a single splitter).I don't plug my fans into this controller, I just plug the fan argb connection into the controller and that is all, no connection to the motherboard.The remote works fine. The controller is behind a steel plate in my case which covers the wiring and of course, the side of the case, so the controller is behind two pieces of metal and the remote works fine from 5 feet away. All buttons work.The only thing I wish this had was a mode for the static colors, like pulse or swirl, I think this is a miss.I bought this because I didn't want to use software to control the argb and also because the mother board bios didn't have any argb control, so while the case hub was fine, when turning on the PC, the argb defaults to rainbow flashing, but with no way to change it.With this I have it set for a static color, no software and the device works really well, its solid.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars You'll probably get the wrong color
reviews.reviewText: Pros:- Powered via SATA, not Molex.- Remote works.- 12 solid colors to choose from, you're unlikely to not find something for your build.- Magnet works well.- The unit itself has RGB, it's bright enough that you almost don't notice the hideous "Cool moon" logo.Cons:- I ordered black and received white. It was stickered as black at the warehouse. If you read through the reviews this has happened quite a bit with this brand, so maybe order a couple or be prepared to return/exchange.- It's quite a bit taller than I was expecting and may have trouble fitting in between the case and side panel or 2.5" drive slot.- The flashy color modes are completely useless except for the default RGB puke. No color themes (purple and blue, orange and teal, etc) or single color with effects possible without software handling it.- All or nothing on colors, you can't control individual channels via the remote despite it having multiple ports.Bottom line: If you just want a single solid color changeable via a remote and no bloatware/spyware, this is basically your only option so long as you have room in your case. Buy multiple if you're worried about getting the wrong color. If you want custom effects and software control, go with a Razer Chroma Controller or invest in Corsair's system.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars does a good job
reviews.reviewText: neat little device. if you know what you are doing and hook it up right it works very well. cheap too.here's what i did:hooked all my RGB sync fans to this device including my water cooler lightshooked the RGB sync input to my motherboardnow my motherboard runs the RGB lighting still which i'm perfectly fine with. does a really good job. mounting is easy cause the bottom of this unit is magnetic. its not strong enough magnetism to harm hard drives but good enough to stay where it is put. i even thought about using a Amazon Alexa enabled LED Light strip controller i have and using it to control the lighting but decided against it and just went the motherboard route instead.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars After a few months controller stop working
reviews.reviewText: The controller stopped working and it's impossible to change the light color. I would like to have a solution for this issue.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what i wanted and needed
reviews.reviewText: This controller works amazingly i have 6 fans plugged into it 5 of them are using both the fan controller and ARGB ports the 6th one is just a old school fan. the remote for it has about a 5 foot range but that more than enough for me.the light controller has many different modes and static color options to choose from, it has a dimming option as well if the lights are too bright for youover all i am very pleased with thisA+

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Works but does not light up, as of a month it had fried. Smoke and sparks everywhere!!!!!!!
reviews.reviewText: Works as suggested but don't light up. Works but does not light up, as of a month it had fried. Smoke and sparks everywhere!!!!!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Magnetic back was ideal to place device exactly where I needed.

The media could not be loaded. Arrived on time and i like the original packaging, keeps the product secured.The Coolmon is a snow white shade of color, i have it located in the case back panel, it is a ARGB Hub, the with over 100 colors, very virbrant and bright, can be dimmed via controlling.The PMW features a argb connection and also multiple slots for fans and ARGB, the link system is simple to install, which i love.I own a Cooler Master TD500 ATX case and Thermalright ARGB Water cooling fans, also every LED you see is from COOLMON (Thats the brand of the Hub you're gonna buy)I suggest you get their products for its capability and compatibility are numerous.It can do what my COOLER MASTER CASE couldn't do, which is Switch colors at a push of a button. Which my Case has but lacks in functionality.Conclusion, if you meed a hub for extra fan slots and argb support, THIS IS THE HUB FOR YOU.It has a slot for reset cable so you can turn your case reset button into a ARGB led button.I reccomend. And thank you Coolmon
Funktioniert einwandfrei wenn man keine andere Möglichkeit hat die Lüfter mit dem Motherboard zu verbinden. Die Fernbedinung hat auch einige gute Einstellmöglichkeiten.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 29, 2023
